answers.answer: Go to page 2, scroll down to this thread for first hand accountCan Type 2 diabetes be reversed?by thomasd11, Jul 30, 2011 08:00PM

Yes, diabetes can be reversed; your readings become what a non-diabetic would show.However I don't believe it can be cured. Once you reach a non-diabetic's readings, you must continue the lifestyle that got you there.

I absolutely agree. There's a reason that a person's BG got that high in the first place.  You can reverse the condition if you drastically cut carbohydrates, and if you aren't too far gone.  I made a drastic lifestyle change, and feel extremely lucky that I am able to maintain, by diet only an average BG of 95 after a fasting test of over 160 only 5 months ago.  However, my BG will climb again if I go back to my old ways.  Bottom line: Once you become a Type 2, you will always be a Type 2.
